verses.verse: A Psalm of David.<WH1732> Blessed<WH1288> be the LORD<WH3068> my strength <WH6697>which teaches<WH3925> my hands<WH3027> to war,<WH4421> <WH7128> and my fingers<WH676> to fight:<WH4421>

My goodness,<WH2617> and my fortress;<WH4686> my high<WH4869> tower,<WH4869> and my deliverer;<WH6403> my shield,<WH4043> and he in whom I trust;<WH2620> who subdues<WH7286> my people<WH5971> under<WH8478> me.
LORD,<WH3068> what<WH4100> is man,<WH120> that you take knowledge<WH3045> of him! or the son<WH1121> of man,<WH582> that you make account<WH2803> of him!
Man<WH120> is like<WH1819> to vanity:<WH1892> his days<WH3117> are as a shadow<WH6738> that passes<WH5674> away.
Bow<WH5186> your heavens,<WH8064> O LORD,<WH3068> and come<WH3381> down:<WH3381> touch<WH5060> the mountains,<WH2022> and they shall smoke.<WH6225>
Cast<WH1299> forth lightning,<WH1300> and scatter<WH6327> them: shoot<WH7971> out your arrows,<WH2671> and destroy<WH1949> them.
Send<WH7971> your hand<WH3027> from above;<WH4791> rid<WH6475> me, and deliver<WH5337> me out of great<WH7227> waters,<WH4325> from the hand<WH3027> of strange<WH5236> children;<WH1121>
Whose<WH834> mouth<WH6310> speaks<WH1696> vanity,<WH7723> and their right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> is a right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> of falsehood.<WH8267>
I will sing<WH7891> a new<WH2319> song<WH7892> to you, O God:<WH430> on a psaltery<WH5035> and an instrument of ten<WH6218> strings will I sing<WH2167> praises to you.
It is he that gives<WH5414> salvation<WH8668> to kings:<WH4428> who delivers<WH6475> David<WH1732> his servant<WH5650> from the hurtful<WH7451> sword.<WH2719>

Rid<WH6475> me, and deliver<WH5337> me from the hand<WH3027> of strange<WH5236> children,<WH1121> whose<WH834> mouth<WH6310> speaks<WH1696> vanity,<WH7723> and their right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> is a right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> of falsehood:<WH8267>

That our sons<WH1121> may be as plants<WH5195> grown<WH1431> up in their youth;<WH5271> that our daughters<WH1323> may be as corner<WH2106> stones,<WH2106> polished<WH2404> after the similitude<WH8403> of a palace:<WH1964>

That our garners<WH4200> may be full,<WH4392> affording<WH6329> all manner<WH2177> of store: that our sheep<WH6629> may bring<WH503> forth thousands<WH503> and ten<WH7231> thousands<WH7233> in our streets:<WH2351>
That our oxen<WH441> may be strong to labor;<WH5445> that there be no<WH369> breaking<WH6556> in, nor<WH369> going<WH3318> out; that there be no<WH369> complaining<WH6682> in our streets.<WH7339>
Happy<WH835> is that people,<WH5971> that is in such<WH3602> a case:<WH3602> yes, happy<WH835> is that people,<WH5971> whose God<WH430> is the LORD.<WH3068>
